answer:
A blood test to confirm immunity to (protection against) the hepatitis B virus is not routinely recommended when there has been a delay between vaccine doses. A longer than recommended interval between doses of the hepatitis B vaccine does not result in reduced protection once all the recommended doses have been received, regardless of the amount of time that has passed between doses. 
Immunization Nurse
question: My first two Hep B shots were on schedule, but my third was many years later. Should I get a blood test to check for immunity, or is a long break between the second and third ok?
question_variation_0: do you test immunity during long break?
question_variation_2: can you break between a blood test
